dump.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to put something somewhere in a careless untidy way
dump.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Merrill dumped her suitcase down in the hall.
They dump tons of salt on icy road surfaces to make driving safer.
He found a can of beef stew and dumped it in a saucepan to heat.
dump.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to get rid of something that you do not want
dump.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Ellie dumped all the photos of her ex-husband.
He dumped her body into the sea.
dump.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to get rid of waste material by taking it from people’s houses and burying it under the soil
dump.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Britain dumps more of its waste than any other European country.
dump.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to end a relationship with someone
dump.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to get rid of goods by selling them in a foreign country at a much lower price
dump.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: a campaign to stop cheap European beef being dumped in West Africa
dump.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to copy information stored in a computer’s memory on to something else such as a disk or magnetic tape
dump.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a place where unwanted waste is taken and left
dump.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Put the rest into a sack to take to the dump.
The fire probably started in a rubbish dump.
dump.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a place where military supplies are stored, or the supplies themselves
dump.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: There has been a series of explosions in an ammunition dump.
dump.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a place that is unpleasant to live in because it is dirty, ugly, untidy etc
dump.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: ‘What a dump, ’ she added as they entered the village.
Why are you living in a dump like this?
dump.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: the act of copying the information stored in a computer’s memory onto something else, such as a disk
dump.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to put waste in a particular place, especially illegally
dump.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: 11 million gallons of crude oil were illegally dumped into Prince William Sound.
dump.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: to sell something that you do not want
dump.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: But before you call your broker and dump all your stockholdings, consider some other data.
dump.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: to sell products cheaply in an export market, perhaps in order to increase your share of the market there
dump.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: Japanese-made display screens are being dumped in the US at below-market prices.
dump.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: to copy information from a computer onto another computer, or onto a TAPE or a DISK
dump.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: Orders placed by credit card are automatically dumped into the computer system.
